item.title: Jason Colavito

Jason Colavito, born in 1981, is an American author and independent scholar known for his work debunking fringe theories, particularly those related to ancient history and extraterrestrials. He has written several books on these topics.

Biography ðŸ”—

Colavito graduated summa cum laude from Ithaca College in 2003 with a bachelor’s degree in anthropology and journalism. He attended Auburn High School before that. His work focuses on debunking alternative archaeology. His work has been cited in The Washington Post, The Huffington Post, and on the History Channel.

Bibliography ðŸ”—

Colavito’s writings have appeared in The New Republic, Slate, Esquire Magazine, and Skeptic magazine.

  • The Cult of Alien Gods: H. P. Lovecraft and Extraterrestrial Pop Culture (2005) explores the influence of H.P. Lovecraft’s Cthulhu Mythos on the works of Erich von DÃ¤niken and Graham Hancock, and its impact on extraterrestrial pop culture.
  • Knowing Fear: Science, Knowledge, and the Development of the Horror Genre (2007) examines the history and science of the horror genre.
  • A Critical Companion to Ancient Aliens Seasons 3 and 4: Unauthorized (2012)
  • Faking History: Essays on Aliens, Atlantis, Monsters, and More (2013)
  • Unearthing the Truth: An Unauthorized Commentary on America Unearthed Season One (2013)
  • Cthulhu in World Mythology (2014)
  • Jason and the Argonauts Through the Ages (2014)
  • The Mound Builder Myth: Fake History and the Hunt for a “Lost White Race” (2020) discusses the myth surrounding mound builders and its connection to ideas of a lost white race.
